content.description: Two non-profit organizations, L and M, accept donations from people. In a certain month, 140 people donated to organization L, with an average donation amount of <math alttext="x bar sub L equals 113 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>113</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and 42 people donated to organization M, with an average donation amount of <math alttext="x bar sub M equals 390 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>390</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the correct unit of measure for the mean of the sampling distribution of <math alttext="x bar sub L minus x bar sub M " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>?

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
